codegenmips

Class RegisterAllocator

  • java.lang.Object
    • codegenmips.RegisterAllocator

  • public class RegisterAllocator
extends java.lang.Object
    manages the available registers. Allocates and deallocates them as needed. The set of registers includes "$t0"-"$t7" and "$s0"-"$s7". When the first set is empty, the second set is used.

      void setARegisterUsed(int regIndex, boolean b)
      marks the given $a register reg as used if b is true.

      • allocTorSRegister

        public java.lang.String allocTorSRegister()

      • deallocRegister

        public void deallocRegister(java.lang.String reg)

      • setARegisterUsed

        public void setARegisterUsed(int regIndex,
                    boolean b)
        marks the given $a register reg as used if b is true. Otherwise, it marks the register as free.
        Parameters:
        b - the boolean indicating whether the reg is used (true) or free (false)

      • getARegistersUsed

        public java.util.SortedSet<java.lang.String> getARegistersUsed()
        Returns:
        a Set of all the a registers that were used, so that they can be saved in the procedure prolog & restored in the postlog

      • getSRegistersUsed

        public java.util.SortedSet<java.lang.String> getSRegistersUsed()
        Returns:
        a Set of all the s registers that were used, so that they can be saved in the procedure prolog & restored in the postlog

      • getTRegistersUsed

        public java.util.SortedSet<java.lang.String> getTRegistersUsed()
        Returns:
        a Set of all the t registers that were used, so that they can be saved in the procedure prolog & restored in the postlog
